comment.author: 16171417@N00
comment._content: It is wonderful to see this set of two images (the contiguous view is www.flickr.com/photos/usnationalarchives/3995358753/) in high quality and in the Public Domain/CC! The version in the ARC catalog was a sad image to look at, knowing the depth of detail in the original. Bravo NARA!

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content:
TJJohn12:

Thanks for your kind words! We here at NARA are very excited about our new Flickr photostream and the newly added Mathew Brady photographs. We plan to add more in small batched during the coming months, so stay tuned.

Jerry (U.S. National Archives)

comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: The Chambersburg Pike is in the right foreground.

comment.author: 89147649@N05
comment._content: I have lived here in Gettysburg all my life, and am writing a book dealing with the war those 3 days.  Its so interesting to see these photos as I've been looking for street maps and photos during that time.  So far all I've found are battlefield maps, but I'm looking for street maps of the town itself.  If anyone has any ideas where I might find something like that I would love to hear!  Thanks so much for putting these photos up here!

comment.author: 16171417@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/catrionadagger/] - Have you looked at Early Photography at Gettysburg by William Frassanito? Bill outlines the history of early maps of Gettysburg, as well as some early post-battle images of the streets.
